title: Please help identify cursive font
content:
I would like to use this font for a project. I know I've seen it before, but I couldn't find anything other than this clip from Liberty Bottleworks. I think this font used to be used in railroad advertisements, and may even still be used today.

What do you think the name of this font is?  
Thank you for helping!!!!!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [script.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015192841/http:/typophile.com/files/script_4.png) | 11.1 KB |
author: kstaehly

comments.content: The closest I have is [Streamline](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015192841/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/streamline/) but /L is different.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015192841im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Liberty_6639.jpg)
  
It certainly started out as Streamline.
Wow! Great! Thank you so much everyone. This was very helpful.
